alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains including Bisbee, Canelo Hills, Madera Canyon; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Santa Catalina and Rincon Mountains including Mount Lemmon, Summerhaven (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 29 at 2:27PM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT ABOVE 7000 FT FROM LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches are possible above 7000 ft. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph Friday and Friday night. * WHERE...Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains, Chiricahua Mountains, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains and Catalina and Rincon Mountains above 7000 ft. * WHEN...From Late Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and significantly reduced visibility in any blowing snow. Bursts of heavy snow may make travel very difficult at best. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...At this time the focus of the heaviest precipitation should be late Thursday night into Friday evening.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may seriously impact travel. Gusty winds and blowing snow is also possible. Those planning travel into the watch area should prepare for difficult winter driving conditions.
